positions.title: Senior UX Designer
positions.body:
• Designed a mobile app to replace warehouse barcode scanners with smartphone-based scanning. Integrated with internal systems, supported data/photo capture, and is now used in 3 global warehouses: USA, Amsterdam, Hong Kong, reducing receiving time and hardware costs.
• Designed the UI for an AI-powered internal tool used by the counterfeit detection lab in the all global warehouses. The tool analyzes microchips using AI and provides automated assistance for faster, more accurate inspections.
• Led the creation of a design system for eight internal applications, conducting UX audits, standardizing typography, and implementing Figma variables, increasing component adoption from ~30% to ~ 90%.
• Designed and optimized Smith’s internal IT Asset Disposition (ITAD) tool in collaboration with Google, aligning workflows across global warehouses for verifying and wiping storage devices.

positions.title: Lead UX Consultant
positions.body: Led UX research, planning, and design for five NSF-funded Science Gateway initiatives under the SGCI(SGX3), managing stakeholder relationships and user-centered design execution.

positions.title: Design Engineer Intern
positions.body:
• Designed and implemented responsive layouts for the OneSignal dashboard and website, enhancing UX for 27% of mobile and tablet users.
• Built reusable, extendable Figma components for the Journeys product.

positions.title: Full-Stack Software Engineer
positions.body:
• Led SEO and UX initiatives, improving Google Lighthouse scores to 90%+ for public-facing pages by refactoring legacy CSS and optimizing code.
• Developed a three-tier caching system using Cloudflare Workers, reducing page load times and serving 75% of requests from cache.
• Spearheaded and mentored the implementation of site-wide dark mode, migrating the legacy design system to TailwindCSS.
